intro: Rathbunia deficiens, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, often with a central disc. Rathbunia deficiens typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and resilience in harsh conditions.
